unnormalised: The Income Tax Department has issued a notice to M/s. Gupta Enterprises, demanding clarification on discrepancies found during the assessment of their FY 2022-23 returns. The notice, dated 22/05/2024, cites differences between the company's declared turnover and the data available through their GSTIN: 27AABBCCDD1ZE. Gupta Enterprises has been given till 15/06/2024 to respond with supporting documentation.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has issued a notice to M slash s. Gupta Enterprises, demanding clarification on discrepancies found during the assessment of their financial year two thousand twenty two two thousand twenty three returns. The notice, dated twenty second May two thousand twenty four, cites differences between the company's declared turnover and the data available through their G-S-T-I-N: twenty seven A-A-B-B-C-C-D-D one Z-E. Gupta Enterprises has been given till fifteenth June two thousand twenty four to respond with supporting documentation.

unnormalised: According to sources within the department, the discrepancies involve a mismatch of approximately Rs. 50 lakh. The notice reportedly highlights a potential underreporting of income, which could lead to penalties under the Income Tax Act, 1961. Further investigations are underway to ascertain the nature and extent of the alleged irregularities.
normalised: According to sources within the department, the discrepancies involve a mismatch of approximately rupee fifty lakh. The notice reportedly highlights a potential underreporting of income, which could lead to penalties under the Income Tax Act, one thousand nine hundred and sixty one. Further investigations are underway to ascertain the nature and extent of the alleged irregularities.

unnormalised: Industry experts suggest that businesses should meticulously reconcile their GST and income tax filings to avoid such situations. The case serves as a reminder for all entities, especially SMEs, to ensure accurate and transparent reporting of financial transactions. The PAN card detail of the company is ABCDE1234F for any further queries.
normalised: Industry experts suggest that businesses should meticulously reconcile their G-S-T and income tax filings to avoid such situations. The case serves as a reminder for all entities, especially S-M-Es, to ensure accurate and transparent reporting of financial transactions.
